sadly she is still highly overloaded :(
and that will cause balance issues in the future :(

that being said, I really like her double jump and ultimate, as well as her passive.
But, still not on live ^^

Ive been playing with / against her / as her on PBE and it is much easier to keep track of what she can do and when she can do it than say, Ekko.

Her kit sounds very overloaded, but the key is that most of it is conditional and not multipurpose. I wouldn't say she is any more overloaded than Renekton, and she doesn't have the defensive tools that someone like Ekko does. The danger in overloading comes with mixing offense AND defense.
i highly disagree with that. The danger of having an overloaded character is the balance issues which will appear in the future.

I think you either misread (or didn't read) my comment.

I wasn't saying that the result of overloading was mixed offense / defense.
I was saying that the result of too much mixed offense / defense (ekko) is an overloaded kit.

As Camille is more kitted out for offense than Ekko, I doubt we will see such issues of the type Ekko caused.
Sure she might be too strong, but I doubt it will be a result of being overloaded.

I did. Sadly Kamille has that too.
She gets defensive from her passive (which I think is very cool).
She gets defensive from becoming untargetable (ult)
She gets defensive from her mobility (e, which again I think is super cool)
She gets defensive from her W (which can slow the enemy making it harder to reach her)
She gets defensive from knocking enemies away (ult)

And then all the types of damage she does with her kit (magic, psychical and true damage) as offensive capabilities.
And a stun to allow chase downs or engages.

An overloaded kit gives the champion the ability to do a lot of multiple things.
I mean. 
Look at Viktor. His kit lets him wave clear, zone control, aoe dmg and burst damage.
That's about it, not overloaded.

Now look at Thresh. His kit allows him to engage, disengage, peal, save allies, poke in lane, stop dashes and shield an ally.
If he gets a buff, even indirectly, it would cause balance issues.
Similar to lee sin which again is supposed to be high skill cap hero. He is so overloaded that for a very high skill cap, he has 50% win rate or higher while being in the top 5 most popular heroes in the game.
Ekko has more utility than utility supports in terms of how many things it can do, while also having higher damage output.

Personally I think Camille looks very cool and interesting to play. But they overloaded her with types of damage. Even if not a lot, it would be a nightmare to balance. Her Q does true damage on second strike, her W does %map hp damage, her R allows her to do magic damage, and her normal attacks do physical damage.
Same reason if fiora gets a slight buff, she goes bad shit crazy as she deals a lot of true damage, combined with high mobility.
I can't think of any clearer way to explain my point, so I am sorry you do not understand what it is I am trying to say.

i'm getting it.
you think overloading is fine unless there's a huge mix of offense and defense

while I'm against a character having 99 options and abilities, except a bitch, that ain't one.
Like seriously, she can:
Do true damage
Do Magic damage
Do AD damage
Do %max hp damage
Slow.
Stun in aoe.
Mobility to move around.
Increased attack speed.
Shield.
Heal.

Wave push.
Untargetability.

She is only missing "ranged attacks". She has CC (almost all forms of it baring something like fear/taunt/charm/silence), she has all forms of damage and a way to heal and shield herself.....

I like the character overall myself.
But Magic Damage, %max hp damage, Heal, AoE stun (was ok with just single target stun), and the movement speed buff were not necessary and are overloading the character.

as a comparison. 
Ekko can:
Stun
Slow
Shield
Heal
Movement speed buff
Mobility to move around
Wave push
Untargetability

You, I see, have fallen victim to the "list everything a champion does and they are overloaded" issue.

Renekton.
good base stats
manaless
AOE Damage
Heal that increases by units hit
manaless
can generate fury by autoattacking
point-and-click targeted stun that applies onhit effects 2 times
Can increase his AA range
can apply onhits 3 times with stun if he has 50 fury
can animation cancel all of his abilities using hydra or ult, and can animation cancel hydra with Q, E and ult.
Free, untargeted mobility
Armor shred
EXTRA mobility if he hits people with the first dash
FREE HP INSTANTLY with ult
FREE SUNFIRE CAPE with ult
Ult increases size of Q


Thing is, you never see people bitch about Renekton being overloaded.
He is actually BETTER at disengaging fights than Camille, if in the hands of a good player. He has MORE control over when/where to fight and for how long.
He is also naturaly tankier and has a very good earlygame. His teamfighting may be poor but his ability to deal with people 1v1 does not go away.

I can come up with a whole slew of champions that are overloaded if Camille is overloaded.

CAMILLE CANNOT: (incoming list of things you say camille can do even though she cannot, or things she does poorly even though you list them as strengths)
Knock back targets. Camille has no control over who she knocks back, she cannot target people to knock them back.
Wave Push. ANY Champion can, she is actually quite weak at it.
Magic Damage. She has a SMALL about of onhit magic damage tied to her ultimate. Not her primary damage type, and not worth accounting for when itemizing vs her.
Mobility: She does have good mobility, but is is restricted by the availability of walls and enemy champions. It is not free - untargeted mobility.
Heal. Her heal is not exactly big. Renekton gets a SIGNIFICANTLY larger heal than her on a much more useable cooldown. It is also very capped vs certain non-player targets.

Knock back targets. Camille has no control over who she knocks back, she cannot target people to knock them back.

she does, she knocks back everyone except her main target

Wave Push. ANY Champion can, she is actually quite weak at it. She has her W, and is AD, naturally building into Tiamat. Renekton as you gave as an example has his Q for wave push which is pretty much the same as Camille's wave push ability. Except rene maxes his first.
A champion with no wave push: Original Fiora. Which is why she HAD to buy tiamat and hydra every game.

She still does magic damage, even if its a little, it will cause balancing problems in the future. Take Ezreal for example, his Q only did a little extra thing, applying spell effects.............. runegleive happened and Ezreal was fucking broken.
